intro: Dematra sericea, commonly known as the silky dematra, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, silvery-green leaves covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft, velvety appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow with a central disc, blooming in late summer to early autumn. Dematra sericea is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
